intro: Neolloydia erectocentra var. acunensis, commonly known as the Acun Mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions, often found in alpine meadows. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are sturdy and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
